channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: OpenAI vs. Apple? Sam Altman is setting his sights on winning what could be an even higher-stakes AI battle
item.description: Altman recruited iPhone designer Jony Ive to OpenAI this May, and Ive has said the company’s secret device could be ready in the next two years.

item.title: New Year’s resolutions don’t work: Try this bingo card instead
item.description: There’s something incredibly compelling about a brand-new year. A fresh start beckons, with each day untroubled by your past decisions. Whatever mista...

item.title: A photo with Trump in it appears to have been removed from the partial Epstein files the Justice Department released
item.description: "This photo, file 468, from the Epstein files that includes Donald Trump has apparently now been removed from the DOJ release."

item.title: American Airlines Just Added a Big New Restriction to Its Frequent Flyer Miles
item.description: Flyers in these seats will be left with one less perk.

item.title: What Leaders Reward Shapes Company Culture
item.description: When an organization rewards love, love multiplies.

item.title: How the ‘Reddit Detective Agency’ and surveillance technology helped find the suspect in the deadly Brown University shooting
item.description: A local Reddit user "blew this case right open” with an old-fashioned tip first posted on the social media platform.

item.title: Why Digital Product Development Needs Strategic Oversight
item.description: Your definition of “obvious” may not be shared. That’s a problem businesses can’t ignore.

item.title: 5 Leadership Lessons from ‘Professor Messi’
item.description: The Major League Soccer champion just taught a masterclass that can benefit leaders in every industry.
